title.narrative: HLB Technical Exchange Visit With Citrus Stakeholders

description.narrative: Support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade.

This award strives to support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade. In addition, this award Citrus greening or Huanglongbing (HLB) is considered one of the most destructive citrus diseases globally and has accounted for substantial economic losses in Asia and the Americas.The project supported a technical visit to South Africa and Swaziland by an APHIS HLB subject matter expert (SME) in order to raise awareness levels and mobilize support for phytosanitary mitigations to address the imminent threat of HLB. Engagements between the HLB SME, NPPO officials and related stakeholders facilitated an exchange of information on perspectives and experiences with the management of HLB in the United States, so that officials are better equipped in terms of their emergency response and Phytosanitary control measures in addressing the threat of HLB..

description.narrative: South Africa continues to be an important strategic partner of the United States. Although it is the second largest economy in Africa, South Africa struggles with serious socioeconomic challenges, including HIV/AIDS and other health concerns, mass unemployment, a failing education system, increasing corruption, poor accountability, and critical levels of violent crime. As South Africa continues to exert leadership in the region, it is working with the United States and other donors to address its social and economic challenges. U.S. investments, in line with South African national development priorities, will target efforts where funding can catalyze innovative approaches for reform and improve efficiency, helping South Africa sustain its democracy and improve the lives of its people
